section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance during any time of the day, including weekdays.
explanation: The text initially states that i-on will maintain the Hosted Site continuously, 24/7, but then immediately introduces an exception for maintenance. The second sentence further allows i-on to perform maintenance at any time, including weekdays. This creates ambiguity and contradicts the promise of continuous operation, as maintenance downtime is not clearly defined or limited, potentially allowing for frequent or lengthy interruptions.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 20th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The text states that the customer has to begin paying the fees on “April 1, 1999.” However, in the introduction paragraph, the contract states that it was entered on “April 6, 1999.” This is a contradiction, as the customer is being asked to pay before the contract has even begun.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than five (5) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: The clause outlines two different ways to end the agreement. The first is with a five-day notice before the end of the term, and the second is with thirty days written notice to terminate the agreement without cause. The thirty-day notice essentially negates the five-day notice because a party could always just use the thirty-day termination clause, making the five-day notice irrelevant. This creates an internal contradiction.
